title: The Block stars Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie's $855,000 North Bondi renovation
text:
The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie have listed their North Bondi apartment for auction in November, following a six-month renovation.

After purchasing the two-bedroom property in July 2018 for $855,000, the stylish grandads are now hoping to make a profit after competently flipping it.

It was first listed for sale in January, around the time Mitch and Mark began filming The Block in Melbourne, but the apartment went unsold.

Auction time! The Block's Mitch Edwards (left) and Mark McKie (right) have listed their North Bondi apartment for auction in November, following a six-month renovation

The apartment's most striking feature is its transformed balcony, which is filled with native plants, turf and plenty of greenery.

With sliding glass doors, the tranquil space flows seamlessly into the huge lounge.

The greenery continues throughout the lounge, with a turf-inspired rug, plenty of plants and foliage, and an artwork depicting several palm trees on a beach.

Wow! After purchasing the two-bedroom property in July 2018 for $855,000, the grandads are hoping to make a profit after competently flipping it. Pictured: The lounge and balcony now

Before! The home is completely unrecognisable from the drab beachside unit they initially purchased. Pictured: The lounge and balcony in 2018

The kitchen appears to have been the couple's most expensive renovation.

Not only have they replaced all of the dated fixtures that were once there, they have knocked down a wall to create an open plan dining and kitchen space.

A marble dining table takes pride of place on one side of the room, and is surrounded by four chic perspex chairs.

Impressive! The kitchen appears to have been the couple's most expensive renovation. Pictured: The dining room and kitchen space now

Dated: Not only have they replaced all of the dated fixtures that were once there, they have knocked down a wall to create an open plan dining and kitchen space. Pictured: The dining room and kitchen space in 2018

In the kitchen itself, light green tiles complement the sleek white furniture and surfaces, while an impressive chandelier hangs over an island.

Similarly, the bathroom has also been gutted and completely replaced.

Fresh white tiles and painted white walls surround two sinks and mirrored cabinets, creating a luxurious feel throughout.
description: The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie have listed their North Bondi apartment for auction in November, following a  six-month renovation.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
